alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 11:02PM CDT until March 31 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN BENTON AND SOUTHEASTERN CARROLL COUNTIES... At 1101 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Huntingdon, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Huntingdon, Camden, Bruceton, Hollow Rock, Clarksburg, Howley, Westport, Hillard, Dollar, Jumbo, Scott Hill, Holladay, Leach, Tate, Garretsburg, Palmer Shelter, Yuma, Buena Vista and Nathan Bedford Forrest State Park. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for west Tennessee. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Memphis.
